course.name: Retailing
course.description: This course introduces the basic concept of retailing and its application in various retailing context. It will cover the major blocks of retailing, such as site-selection, display analysis, pricing and advertising strategies.

reviews.author: blessme
reviews.comment_content:
Learning Objectives:
This course provides a customer centric approach to understand what retailing is all about. The
primary focus of this course will be on understanding customers’ shopping behavior and
developing retailing strategy with the understanding of why and how consumers buy. Topics
such as in-store space management, pricing, promotion etc. will be discussed. The course is relevant
for students interested in working for retailers, for retail-affiliated business such as wholesalers or
manufacturers, and retailer-related functions such as advertising or third- party logistics providers.
The topics we will cover provide a firm foundation in many dimensions of retailing, including
merchandising, pricing, promotion and site selection.

LECTURES : Retailing-specific concepts and decisions will be introduced and discussed
extensively. Some of the key concepts from your previous marketing courses will be reviewed
and their application in the retailing setting will be discussed.

CASE DISCUSSION: Considering real-life problems confronted by retailers refines the analytical
and presentation skills as well as facilitates effective learning by applying theoretical concepts
to solve real-world problems. Case discussion is used as primary learning tool in this course.
You are expected to read each case and prepare for the in-class case discussion. Discussion
questions will be assigned prior to class to facilitate case discussion.

GROUP PROJECTS : There will be a project that allows you apply what you learn from the class to
the real-life retailing setting. In this group project, you will choose one store and analyze its
retailing strategies. Primary data from store visits/being mysterious shoppers as well as
secondary data are expected to support your discussion. Detailed project guideline will be
distributed in class.

Easy content

reviews.author: vixxf6
reviews.title: Out of my expectation
reviews.comment_content:
Please see others' comments.

Remember to read the case because she likes to ask questions randomly. She can remember my name and ask me questions even though I did not raise up my hand. So, be careful. (Of course, you will have a great impression if you always answer questions actively in class)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her teaching is quite boring actually. She will explain the introduction part of a chapter for 40mins but 10 minutes for 10 slides which include so many important concepts. But the contents are informative and important for marketing students I would say.

Remember to go to class because she will assign in-class exercise which would be marked as attendance. She nearly has in-class exercise at every class! So, remember to go to class.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. I was afraid that I would get a bad grade in marketing course again because I got a C in mark2120. But the grade for this class is pretty good. I got a B+ for this course.
reviews.comment_workload: I like her style of doing the project. She will give us the deadlines for each part of the project. I figured out that there are many edges for this style. First, you can figure out who is the free-rider of your group and you can report to the professor right at the start of the project. Second, you don't need to rush for your final report while you are handing in other reports for other subjects at the same time. Third, you will receive suggestions from your professor for every part of your report. It is more easy for you to clarify the concepts and finalize the final report.
